mmgpy.sampling¶

Sampling methods

Geometric methods¶

Uniform grid¶

sampling.uniform_grid(bounds, n_sample, flatten=True, edges=False, form='sx', **kwargs)

Uniform Grid (UG): Uniform grid (UG) is the simplest sampling method in which the samples are created using node points at fixed intervals uniformly distributed for every dimension.

Parameters

  • bounds

  • n_sample

  • flatten

  • edges

  • form

  • kwargs

Notes

  • The coverage of the input space using UG is very poor for low number of sampling points and high dimensions.

Full factorial¶

sampling.full_factorial(bounds, n_sample_tuple, flatten=True, edges=True, form='sx', **kwargs)

Custom Grid (CG): This Grid method is the sample as the UG method, but allows for non-uniform grid sampling.

Parameters

  • bounds

  • n_sample_tuple

  • flatten

  • edges

  • form

  • kwargs

Notes

  • The coverage of the input space using CG is very poor for low number of sampling points and high dimensions.
